revised_title: Investigation of Koji and its Diastase Properties
tldr: The author investigates the process of converting starch into sugar using koji, a substance prepared from steamed rice with the help of a fungus. The study shows that koji has properties similar to malt-extract and can rapidly invert cane-sugar, hydrate maltose and dextrin, and liquefy starch-paste, ultimately producing dextrose and dextrin.
